CatDescriptText: Pete Karkalla, unemployed porter, Castle Shannon and William H. Tillery, parking lot manager, 14th Ward, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, May 19, 1962, pg. 9 with question: "Do you think that, eventually, the City of Pittsburgh will come to include the outlying suburbs under a metropolitan plan of government?"  Mr. Karkalla's answer reads: "Some day it will probably happen.  They might as well unite.  It would be a good thing."  Mr. Tillery's answer reads: "No, I don't think so.  I doubt that this city would be able to join up with and to get along with other cities like Duquesne and all.  Could happen though."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Pete Karkalla wearing fedora and crisscross shirt, standing on sidewalk in front of brick building and telephone booth; Portrait of William H. Tillery wearing dark hat, eyeglasses, and button down shirt with rolled sleeves, standing on sidewalk with telephone booth on the left
